How does synchronization with Google Drive work
Your notes are automatically backed up to your personal Google Drive account. This ensures that your data is securely stored and can be accessed from multiple devices
Where are my notes stored in Google Drive?

Your notes are stored in a hidden app-specific folder in your Google Drive, which means they won’t appear in your regular Drive file list. This folder is private and only accessible by you—no one else, including the app developer, has access to your notes
Do I need a Google account to use synchronization
Yes, you must sign in with a Google account to enable cloud synchronization
Can I access my notes directly from Google Drive?
No, the notes are stored in a private app folder that is not visible through the Google Drive interface. You can only access them through the app
What happens if I uninstall the app? Will my notes be deleted?
Uninstalling the app does not delete your notes from Google Drive. When you reinstall the app and sign in with the same Google account, your notes will be restored
Can I sync my notes across multiple devices?
Yes! As long as you sign in with the same Google account on all devices, your notes will be synchronized
Is my data secure
Yes. Your notes are stored in a private, app-specific Google Drive folder, and the app does not share your data with anyone
What happens if I change my Google account
If you switch to a different Google account, your notes from the previous account won’t be available. To access them, you need to switch back to the original Google account
